extendedIngredients.name: belgian endives
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound Belgian endives (preferably half red and half white), cut crosswise into 1 1/2-inch pieces and separated
extendedIngredients.originalName: Belgian endives (preferably half red and half white), cut crosswise into 1 1/2-inch pieces and separated

extendedIngredients.name: flat-leaf parsley
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 tablespoons finely chopped chervil or flat-leaf parsley
extendedIngredients.originalName: finely chopped chervil or flat-leaf parsley

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil (preferably French or mild)
extendedIngredients.originalName: extra-virgin olive oil (preferably French or mild)

title: Red and White Endive Salad
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Red and White Endive Salad a try. This caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 recipe serves 4 and costs $1.31 per serving. One serving contains 142 calories, 1g of protein, and 14g of fat. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. If you have dijon mustard, shallot, chives, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 15 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 59%. This score is good. Similar recipes include Endive Spears with White Bean Radicchio Salad, Endive With White Bean Dip, and White Bean Puree on Endive.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Whisk together vinegar, shallot, mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking until combined.                                                                Just before serving, add endives and herbs, tossing to coat.                                                Cooks' note:            Endives can be washed and dried 1 day ahead and chilled in sealed bags lined with paper towels.

steps.step: Whisk together vinegar, shallot, mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking until combined.
Just before serving, add endives and herbs, tossing to coat.
Endives can be washed and dried 1 day ahead and chilled in sealed bags lined with paper towels.
